Football

Kylian Mbappe in hysterics as NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo cracks joke about Al-Hilal salary, while LeBron James joins in



Phil Spencer

Published: 7:18, 25 Jul 2023
Updated: 8:49, 25 Jul 2023






Phil Spencer

Published: Invalid Date, 





Kylian Mbappe saw the funny side of NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo's social media post in which he joked about taking the Saudi millions instead.

Reports that Al-Hilal tabled an eye-watering £260million deal for the France star was the talk of the day, with it said Paris Saint-Germain granted the player permission to talk to the Saudi Pro League side.



2

Mbappe will be a rich man if he takes the contract offered to him by Al HilalCredit: Getty
It is thought Mbappe could earn £605m for just one season's work if he accepts the offer, which there is no indication he would.

The current highest-earner in the league is Cristiano Ronaldo who pockets £62m-a-year with Al-Nassr - an astronomical amount that would be dwarfed by Mbappe's deal should a move to Saudi Arabia come off.

Taking to Twitter, Milwaukee Bucks star Antetokounmpo joked: "Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe," with two laughing emojis.

The NBA star's post led Mbappe to retweet with with no less than 13 laughing emojis of his own.



MORE ON KYLIAN MBAPPE
 Mbappe could top list of highest-paid athletes putting Ronaldo and Messi in the shade


 The mind-blowing £605m one-year salary Kylian Mbappe is being offered by Al Hilal





Meanwhile, other basketball stars also made light of the crazy money on offer for just one year's work.

Golden State Warriors' Draymond Green wrote: "They got basketball leagues too right? I don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet."

Damian Lilliard of the Portland Trail Blazers added: "One year, 776mm? Wtf lol."

The best player around LeBron James posted a GIF of Tom Hanks in Forrest Gump running, joking that he's on his way.





Most read in Football



 Forest launch complaint as footage shows Toney gain cheeky advantage before comeback goal





 Gymshark CEO Ben Francis responds to claims he's going to buy Reading





 West Ham see approach for Aston Villa striker turned down





 Jude Bellingham heroics sees Real Madrid snatch last-gasp comeback in stunning scenes










2

Mbappe couldn't help but laugh at Antetokounmpo's post
Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal! ✌‍♂️ pic.twitter.com/IX0VSMZYNb
— LeBron James (@KingJames) July 25, 2023





James will make $53.4m as the NBA's highest paid player in the 2023/24 season and Mbappe's earnings would dwarf that.

Mbappe, 24, is expected to leave PSG this summer after refusing to sign a new contract with the Ligue 1 side, which expires in 2024.

It is reported there has been interest in the player from Chelsea, Man United and Tottenham in recent days.

Asked about a loan move for Mbappe, United boss Erik ten Hag said: "We never speak about players who are under contract in other clubs."



Mbappe is holding out for a move to Real Madrid when his deal expires next summer, paving the way for Al-Hilal to swoop for the player with a one-year deal reportedly on the table.

Al Hilal's squad includes former Chelsea defender Kalidou Koulibaly, Serbia international Sergej Milinkovic-Savic and ex-Wolves midfielder Ruben Neves.

The club is one of four Saudi Pro League clubs who are majority-owned by the Saudi Public Investment Fund (PIF), a sovereign wealth fund with assets under management reportedly worth more than £500billion.

<div class="article__headline-section--kicker article__headline-section"><h1 class="amp-no-kicker article__headline" data-original-text="Kylian Mbappe in hysterics as NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo cracks joke about Al-Hilal salary, while LeBron James joins in">Kylian Mbappe in hysterics as NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo cracks joke about Al-Hilal salary, while LeBron James joins in</h1>
</div>
<div class="article__subdeck t-p-border-color">
</div>

<div class="article__content"><p><strong>Kylian Mbappe saw the funny side of NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo's social media post in which he joked about taking the Saudi millions instead.</strong></p>

<p>Reports that Al-Hilal tabled an eye-watering <a href="https://talksport.com/football/1509661/kylian-mbappe-wages-al-hilal-saudi-arabia-psg/" target="_blank">£260million</a> deal for the France star was the talk of the day, with it said Paris Saint-Germain granted the player permission to talk to the Saudi Pro League side.</p>
<div class="advert-wrapper advert-wrapper--header"><div id="header" class="dfp-ad advert--header"></div>
</div>

<figure class="article__media"><div class="article__media-img-container open-gallery" data-index="1008125"><a href="https://talksport.com/football/1510247/kylian-mbappe-al-hilal-giannis-antetokounmpo-twitter/" target="_blank"><img alt="Mbappe will be a rich man if he takes the contract offered to him by Al Hilal" height="606" width="960" class="lazyload" data-src="https://talksport.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/5/2023/03/kylian-mbappe-france-celebrates-first-805545650.jpg" data-credit="Getty" class="article__gallery-count-value">2</span></div>
</div>
<figcaption class="article__media-caption"><span class="article__media-span">Mbappe will be a rich man if he takes the contract offered to him by Al Hilal</span><span class="article__credit">Credit: Getty</span></figcaption></figure>
<p>It is thought <a href="https://talksport.com/football/1509661/kylian-mbappe-wages-al-hilal-saudi-arabia-psg/" target="_blank">Mbappe could earn £605m</a> for just one season's work if he accepts the offer, which there is no indication he would.</p>

<p>The current highest-earner in the league is <a href="https://talksport.com/who/cristiano-ronaldo/" target="_blank">Cristiano Ronaldo</a> who pockets £62m-a-year with Al-Nassr - an astronomical amount that would be dwarfed by Mbappe's deal should a move to Saudi Arabia come off.</p>

<p>Taking to Twitter, Milwaukee Bucks star Antetokounmpo joked: "Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe," with two laughing emojis.</p>

<p>The NBA star's post led Mbappe to retweet with with no less than 13 laughing emojis of his own.</p>

<p>Meanwhile, other basketball stars also made light of the crazy money on offer for just one year's work.</p>

<p>Golden State Warriors' Draymond Green wrote: "They got basketball leagues too right? I don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet."</p>

<p>Damian Lilliard of the Portland Trail Blazers added: "One year, 776mm? Wtf lol."</p>

<p>The best player around LeBron James posted a GIF of Tom Hanks in Forrest Gump running, joking that he's on his way.</p>

<div class="lazyload oembed-container oembed-twitter"><blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-width="550"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Me headed to Saudi when they call <a href="https://twitter.com/RichPaul4?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">@RichPaul4</a> & <a href="https://twitter.com/mavcarter?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">@mavcarter</a> for that 1 year deal! ✌‍♂️ <a href="https://t.co/IX0VSMZYNb" target="_blank">pic.twitter.com/IX0VSMZYNb</a></p>

<div class="lazyload" data-script="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js"></div>


</div>

<p>James will make $53.4m as the NBA's highest paid player in the 2023/24 season and Mbappe's earnings would dwarf that.</p>

<p>Mbappe, 24, is expected to leave PSG this summer after refusing to sign a new contract with the Ligue 1 side, which expires in 2024.</p>

<p>It is reported there has been interest in the player from Chelsea, Man United and Tottenham in recent days.</p>

<p>Asked about a loan move for Mbappe, United boss Erik ten Hag said: "We never speak about players who are under contract in other clubs."</p>
<div class="advert-wrapper advert-wrapper--advert-inarticle-mpu"><div id="advert-inarticle-mpu" class="dfp-ad advert--in-article-mpu nuk-ad-placeholder" data-ad-label="inArticleMPU"></div>
</div>

<p>Mbappe is holding out for a move to <a href="https://talksport.com/sport/football/team/113141/real-madrid/" target="_blank">Real Madrid</a> when his deal expires next summer, paving the way for Al-Hilal to swoop for the player with a one-year deal reportedly on the table.</p>

<p>Al Hilal's squad includes former Chelsea defender Kalidou Koulibaly, Serbia international Sergej Milinkovic-Savic and ex-Wolves midfielder Ruben Neves.</p>

<p>The club is one of four Saudi Pro League clubs who are majority-owned by the Saudi Public Investment Fund (PIF), a sovereign wealth fund with assets under management reportedly worth more than £500billion.</p>
